name: AWS IAM
description: This app integrates with Amazon Web Services Identity Access Management (AWS IAM) to support various containment, corrective and investigate actions

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Get details of all the groups and attached policies for the user

actions.verbose: By default groups from path '/' are fetched.

If both parameters are provided, users belonging to specified group and to specified path are fetched. If only user path or group name is provided, users belonging to specified path or group respectively are fetched. If no parameters are provided, users belonging to default user path '/' are fetched.

actions.description: List roles available in AWS IAM

example_values: Ready only access for Redlock to do its thing and generate test data.
User testUser successfully added to the group Test-Group
User testUser successfully removed from the group Test-Group

actions.description: Delete user from AWS IAM account
actions.verbose: Delete user and user profile as well as all its associations with groups, policies, and access keys from AWS IAM account

example_values: User testUser deleted successfully along with all its associations with login profile, access keys, groups, and policies

actions.description: Disable login profile and access keys of a user
actions.verbose: If disable access keys parameter is marked false, only login profile is disabled. By default both are disabled.

actions.description: Enable login profile and access keys of a user
actions.verbose:
If enable access keys parameter is marked false, only login profile is enabled. By default both are enabled.

Please exercise caution when using this action. The password may be kept and logged in clear text.

enable_access_keys.description: Enable access keys of user along with login profile

actions.description: Add new role in AWS IAM account
actions.verbose:
Creation of role is a 3 step process. First instance profile is created with the provided role name, then role is created with the same name, and finally the created role is attached with the instance profile created earlier.

Please exercise caution when using this action. Special characters are not allowed in parameter role path.

role_policy_document.description: JSON string mentioning trust relationship policy document with the role

example_values: Role testRole successfully added in AWS account

actions.description: Remove role from AWS IAM account
actions.verbose: Remove role and role instance profiles along with associations of role with all attached policies

example_values: Role test-Role removed successfully along with all its associations with login instance profiles and policies

actions.description: Attach managed policy to a role

example_values: Policy with ARN arn:aws:iam::123456789012:policy/testPolicy successfully attached with role test-Role

actions.description: Detach managed policy from a role

example_values: Policy with ARN arn:aws:iam::123456789012:policy/testPolicy successfully detached from role test-Role

actions.description: Assign managed policy to the user

example_values: Policy with ARN arn:aws:iam::1234567890:policy/testPolicy successfully assigned to user testUser

actions.description: Remove managed policy association with the user

example_values: Policy with ARN arn:aws:iam::123456789012:policy/testPolicy successfully removed from user testUser
